faq:
Q: What are mixed fertilizers (NPK)?
A: NPK fertilizers are represented by a three-number sequence, such as 10-10-10, indicating the percentage by weight of each nutrient. For example, 10-10-10 means the fertilizer contains 10% Nitrogen, 10% Phosphorus, and 10% Potassium elements in the chemical mixture. Some examples are below:
0-40-37, 0-40-40, 0-49-32, 0-52-34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0-55-18, 0-60-20, 0-9-46, 10-26-26, 10-54-10, 11-44-11, 12-11-18, 12-32-16, 12-61-0, 13-0-45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13-40-13, 19-19-19, 20-20-0-13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24-24-0, 30-10-10, 6-34-17
Or 0:40:37, 0:40:40, 0:49:32, 0:52:34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0:55:18, 0:60:20, 0:9:46, 10:26:26, 10:54:10, 11:44:11, 12:11:18, 12:32:16, 12:61:0, 13:0:45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13:40:13, 19:19:19, 20:20:0:13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24:24:0, 30:10:10, 6:34:17
Or 0.40.37, 0.40.40, 0.49.32, 0.52.34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0.55.18, 0.60.20, 0.9.46, 10.26.26, 10.54.10, 11.44.11, 12.11.18, 12.32.16, 12.61.0, 13.0.45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13.40.13, 19.19.19, 20.20.0.13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24.24.0, 30.10.10, 6.34.17

messages.content:
9-24-24 khad ka matlab hai ki isme 9% Nitrogen, 24% Phosphorus, aur 24% Potassium hai. Yeh khad aapke banana ke podhe ke liye achha rahega, kyunki:

- **Nitrogen (N)**: Podhon ki growth aur patton ki development ke liye zaroori hai.
- **Phosphorus (P)**: Root development aur flowering ke liye mahatvapurn hai.
- **Potassium (K)**: Podhon ki overall health, disease resistance, aur fruit quality ke liye zaroori hai.

Is khad ka istemal aapke podhe ki early vegetative growth aur flowering stage ke liye sahi rahega. Aap is khad ko fertigation ke zariye de sakte hain, ya phir soil application ke roop mein bhi istemal kar sakte hain. 

Yadi aapko is khad ka istemal karna hai, to aapko iski matra aur istemal ka samay dhyan se dekhna hoga, taaki podhe ko sahi poshan mil sake.
messages.en:
9.24.24 Fertilizer means that it contains 9% nitrogen, 24% phosphorus, and 24% potassium. This compost will be good for your banana plant, because:

- **Nitrogen (N)**: Essential for plant growth and leaf development.
- Phosphorus (P): Important for root development and flooring.
- Potassium (K): Essential for plant overall health, disease resistance, and fruit quality.

Using this compost will be perfect for your plant's early vegetative growth and flowering stage. You can use this fertilizer through fertigation, or as a soil application. 

If you have to use this compost, you have to carefully check its quantity and time of use, so that the plant can get the right nutrition.

tools:
get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".

get_specific_fertigation_requirements  
Finds the fertigation requirements for the plots with a particular crop stage and week numbers.
faq:
Q: Does Fyllo provide a fertigation schedule?
A: Yes, Fyllo provides a fertigation schedule for users.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: How can I trust that Fyllo's fertigation schedule is accurate?
A: Fyllo's fertigation schedule is scientifically developed and validated based on crop requirements. It takes into account factors such as crop variety, growth stage, soil conditions, and available nutrient data from soil, leaf, or petiole tests when available.

Q: Where can I find the fertigation schedule in the Fyllo app?
A: To access the fertigation schedule:
    1. Open the Fyllo app
    2. Select "My Farm" at the bottom
    3. Tap on the "Fertigation" option
   You'll find the fertigation schedule there, including details about the required fertilizer applications.

Q: If I don't add any test data, what is the basis for the generated fertigation schedule?
A: When no specific test data is provided, Fyllo generates a basic fertigation schedule based on:

    1. Typical nutrient needs for your crop type
    2. General soil characteristics common in your region
    3. Standard growing practices for your area
    This schedule provides a starting point, but may not be as precise as one based on specific test data.

messages.content:
Agar aap podhe ko khad nahi denge, to yeh unki growth ko prabhavit kar sakta hai. Banana ke podhe ko sahi poshan ki zarurat hoti hai, khaas kar jab wo "Crop establishment" stage se guzar rahe hote hain. 

Agar aap khad nahi dalte hain, to podhe ki growth dheere ho sakti hai, aur unki health bhi prabhavit ho sakti hai. Isliye, yeh zaruri hai ki aap agle fertigation schedule ka intezar karein aur us samay sahi khad ka istemal karein.

Agar aapko kisi bhi samasya ka samna karna padta hai, to aap soil ya leaf testing karwa sakte hain, taaki aapko podhe ki specific nutrient needs ka pata chal sake.
messages.en:
If you do not fertilize the plants, it can affect their growth. Banana plants need proper nutrition, especially when they are going through the "crop establishment" stage. 

If you do not fertilize, the growth of the plants can be slow, and their health can also be affected. Therefore, it is important that you wait for the next fertigation schedule and use the right fertilizer at that time.

If you face any problems, you can get soil or leaf testing done to find out the specific nutrient needs of the plant.

messages.content: करपा कसा ओळखयाचा
messages.en: How to identify Karpa
messages.standalone_question: How can I recognize a karpa?
messages.standalone_en: How can I recognize a karpa?

messages.content:
करपा (Caterpillar) ओळखण्यासाठी खालील लक्षणे पहा:

1. **पानांवर खाणे**: करपा पानांवर खाण्याची खुण असते. पानांचे कड किंवा मध्यभाग खाणे.
2. **पानांचे नुकसान**: पानांवर छिद्र किंवा चिरा दिसू शकतो.
3. **किडे**: करपा सामान्यतः पानांच्या तळाशी किंवा कोंबांवर आढळतात.
4. **पुंजक्यांमध्ये लपणे**: काही वेळा ते पानांच्या कडांमध्ये किंवा कोंबांमध्ये लपलेले असतात.

जर तुम्हाला तुमच्या पिकांमध्ये करप्याची उपस्थिती आढळली, तर योग्य कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करणे आवश्यक आहे.
messages.en:
Look for the following symptoms to identify Caterpillar:

1. **Eating on leaves**: Karpa leaves have a sign of eating. Eat the edges or center of the leaves.
2. **Leaf damage**: A hole or incision may appear on the leaves.
3. **Insects**: Karpa is commonly found on the bottom or stems of leaves.
4. *** Hidden in petals**: Sometimes they are hidden in the edges or shoots of leaves.

If you find the presence of fungi in your crops, it is important to use proper pesticides.

messages.content: त्यावर उपाय
messages.en: The solution
messages.standalone_question: What are the solutions for dealing with caterpillars?
messages.standalone_en: What are the solutions for dealing with caterpillars?

messages.content:
पिकांच्या बियाण्याच्या टप्प्यात येणाऱ्या महत्त्वाच्या किड्यांवर उपाय:

1. **आंट्स (Ants)**:
   - नियंत्रण: बागेत आंट्सच्या उपस्थितीवर लक्ष ठेवा. त्यांना नियंत्रित करण्यासाठी बोरिक आम्ल किंवा इतर कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करा.

2. **टर्माइट्स (Termites)**:
   - नियंत्रण: टर्माइट्सच्या उपस्थितीवर लक्ष ठेवा. त्यांना नियंत्रित करण्यासाठी कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करा.

3. **रूट एफिड्स (Root Aphids)**:
   - नियंत्रण: रूट एफिड्ससाठी, Chlorpyriphos @ 5mL/Ltr किंवा Thiamethoxam @ 0.5g/ltr चा वापर करा.

4. **थ्रिप्स (Thrips)**:
   - नियंत्रण: थ्रिप्ससाठी, योग्य कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करा.

5. **आंतरिक बोरर (Internal Borers)**:
   - नियंत्रण: आंतरिक बोररच्या उपस्थितीवर लक्ष ठेवा आणि योग्य कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करा.

**महत्त्वाच्या रोगांवर उपाय**:

1. **कॉलर रॉट (Collar Rot)**:
   - नियंत्रण: Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr चा वापर करा.

2. **डॅम्पिंग ऑफ (Damping Off)**:
   - नियंत्रण: Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr चा वापर करा.

3. **सीड्लिंग ब्लाइट (Seedling Blight)**:
   - नियंत्रण: Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr चा वापर करा.

या उपायांचा वापर करून तुम्ही तुमच्या पिकांचे संरक्षण करू शकता.
messages.en:
Remedies for important insects that fall into the seeding stage of flowers:

1. **Ants**:
   - Control: Keep an eye on the presence of intestines in the garden. Use boric acid or other insecticides to control them.

2. Termites:
   - Control: Keep an eye on the presence of termites. Use insecticides to control them.

3. Root Aphids:
   - Control: For root aphids, use Chlorpyriphos @ 5mL/Ltr or Thiamethoxam @ 0.5g/ltr.

4. Thrips:
   - Control: For thrips, use the appropriate insecticides.

5. Internal Borers:
   - Control: Watch out for the presence of internal borers and use appropriate insecticides.

**Important Remedies for Diseases**:

1. Collar Rot:
   - Control: Use Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr.

2. Damping Off:
   - Control: Use Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr.

3. Seedling Blight:
   - Control: Use Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr.

Using these measures, you can protect your crops.

faq:
Q: why to use insecticide and fungicide for seed treatment?
A:
- Prevents the spread of plant diseases/pest
- Protects the seed from seed rot and seedling blights
- Improves the seed germination
- Provides protection from storage insects
- Controls the soil insects

Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: How does the device predict diseases and pests?
A: It captures data from different parameters using sensors and analyzes it using various agronomical algorithms, including different models for all diseases and pests.
   Each disease and pest has a specific etymology, which is the suitable environment for its incidence.

Q: What are the important Pest occur during seedling stage and control measures?
A: Ants, Termites, root aphids, thrips and internal borer’s pest infect during seedling stage
Drench/spray seedling with: Chlorpyriphos @ 5mL/Ltr or Thiamethoxam @ 0.5g/ltr

messages.content: करपा कसा ओळखयाचा
messages.en: How to identify Karpa
messages.standalone_question: How can I recognize a crab?
messages.standalone_en: How can I recognize a crab?

messages.content:
करपा (Caterpillar) ओळखण्यासाठी खालील लक्षणे पहा:

1. **पानांवर खाणे**: करपा पानांवर खाण्याची खुण असते. पानांचे कड किंवा मध्यभाग खाणे.
2. **पानांचे नुकसान**: पानांवर छिद्र किंवा चिरा दिसू शकतो.
3. **किडे**: करपा सामान्यतः पानांच्या तळाशी किंवा कोंबांवर आढळतात.
4. **पुंजक्यांमध्ये लपणे**: काही वेळा ते पानांच्या कडांमध्ये किंवा कोंबांमध्ये लपलेले असतात.

जर तुम्हाला तुमच्या पिकांमध्ये करप्याची उपस्थिती आढळली, तर योग्य कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करणे आवश्यक आहे.
messages.en:
Look for the following symptoms to identify Caterpillar:

1. **Eating on leaves**: Karpa leaves have a sign of eating. Eat the edges or center of the leaves.
2. **Leaf damage**: A hole or incision may appear on the leaves.
3. **Insects**: Karpa is commonly found on the bottom or stems of leaves.
4. *** Hidden in petals**: Sometimes they are hidden in the edges or shoots of leaves.

If you find the presence of fungi in your crops, it is important to use proper pesticides.

messages.content: त्यावर उपाय
messages.en: The solution
messages.standalone_question: What are the solutions for dealing with caterpillars?
messages.standalone_en: What are the solutions for dealing with caterpillars?

messages.content:
पिकांच्या बियाण्याच्या टप्प्यात येणाऱ्या महत्त्वाच्या किड्यांवर उपाय:

1. **आंट्स (Ants)**:
   - नियंत्रण: बागेत आंट्सच्या उपस्थितीवर लक्ष ठेवा. त्यांना नियंत्रित करण्यासाठी बोरिक आम्ल किंवा इतर कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करा.

2. **टर्माइट्स (Termites)**:
   - नियंत्रण: टर्माइट्सच्या उपस्थितीवर लक्ष ठेवा. त्यांना नियंत्रित करण्यासाठी कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करा.

3. **रूट एफिड्स (Root Aphids)**:
   - नियंत्रण: रूट एफिड्ससाठी, Chlorpyriphos @ 5mL/Ltr किंवा Thiamethoxam @ 0.5g/ltr चा वापर करा.

4. **थ्रिप्स (Thrips)**:
   - नियंत्रण: थ्रिप्ससाठी, योग्य कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करा.

5. **आंतरिक बोरर (Internal Borers)**:
   - नियंत्रण: आंतरिक बोररच्या उपस्थितीवर लक्ष ठेवा आणि योग्य कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करा.

**महत्त्वाच्या रोगांवर उपाय**:

1. **कॉलर रॉट (Collar Rot)**:
   - नियंत्रण: Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr चा वापर करा.

2. **डॅम्पिंग ऑफ (Damping Off)**:
   - नियंत्रण: Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr चा वापर करा.

3. **सीड्लिंग ब्लाइट (Seedling Blight)**:
   - नियंत्रण: Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr चा वापर करा.

या उपायांचा वापर करून तुम्ही तुमच्या पिकांचे संरक्षण करू शकता.
messages.en:
Remedies for important insects that fall into the seeding stage of flowers:

1. **Ants**:
   - Control: Keep an eye on the presence of intestines in the garden. Use boric acid or other insecticides to control them.

2. Termites:
   - Control: Keep an eye on the presence of termites. Use insecticides to control them.

3. Root Aphids:
   - Control: For root aphids, use Chlorpyriphos @ 5mL/Ltr or Thiamethoxam @ 0.5g/ltr.

4. Thrips:
   - Control: For thrips, use the appropriate insecticides.

5. Internal Borers:
   - Control: Watch out for the presence of internal borers and use appropriate insecticides.

**Important Remedies for Diseases**:

1. Collar Rot:
   - Control: Use Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr.

2. Damping Off:
   - Control: Use Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr.

3. Seedling Blight:
   - Control: Use Carbendazim @ 2.5g/ltr.

Using these measures, you can protect your crops.

messages.standalone_en: What are the solutions for controlling pests and diseases in crops?

faq:
Q: why to use insecticide and fungicide for seed treatment?
A:
- Prevents the spread of plant diseases/pest
- Protects the seed from seed rot and seedling blights
- Improves the seed germination
- Provides protection from storage insects
- Controls the soil insects

Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: How does the device predict diseases and pests?
A: It captures data from different parameters using sensors and analyzes it using various agronomical algorithms, including different models for all diseases and pests.
   Each disease and pest has a specific etymology, which is the suitable environment for its incidence.

Q: What are the important Pest occur during seedling stage and control measures?
A: Ants, Termites, root aphids, thrips and internal borer’s pest infect during seedling stage
Drench/spray seedling with: Chlorpyriphos @ 5mL/Ltr or Thiamethoxam @ 0.5g/ltr

तुमच्या अपलोड केलेल्या चित्रात करप्याचे विशेष लक्षणे आढळलेली नाहीत. तथापि, तुम्हाला खालील गोष्टींचा विचार करावा लागेल:

1. **हवा परिसंवाद सुधारणा**: पिके एकत्रित न ठेवता हवा चांगली फिरवण्यासाठी जागा ठेवा, ज्यामुळे आर्द्रता कमी होईल.
2. **नियमित तपासणी**: पानांवर किडे किंवा रोगाचे लक्षणे तपासा.
3. **संस्कृती पद्धती**: संक्रमित पानांना काढून टाका आणि शेतात स्वच्छता ठेवा.

जर लक्षणे वाढली किंवा नवीन लक्षणे दिसली, तर स्थानिक कृषी तज्ञांशी संपर्क साधा.

tools:
get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".

get_specific_fertigation_requirements  
Finds the fertigation requirements for the plots with a particular crop stage and week numbers.
faq:
Q: Does Fyllo provide a fertigation schedule?
A: Yes, Fyllo provides a fertigation schedule for users.

Q: Where can I find the fertigation schedule in the Fyllo app?
A: To access the fertigation schedule:
    1. Open the Fyllo app
    2. Select "My Farm" at the bottom
    3. Tap on the "Fertigation" option
   You'll find the fertigation schedule there, including details about the required fertilizer applications.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: How do I generate a fertigation schedule in the app?
A: To generate a fertigation schedule, follow these steps:

    1. Go to "My Farm"
    2. Select "Fertigation"
    3. Tap "Create Report"
    4. Fill in all the required details
    5. Save the report
    If you have soil, leaf, or petiole test data, you can input this for a more customized schedule. Otherwise, we can generate a basic schedule using general crop and regional data.

Q: How can I trust that Fyllo's fertigation schedule is accurate?
A: Fyllo's fertigation schedule is scientifically developed and validated based on crop requirements. It takes into account factors such as crop variety, growth stage, soil conditions, and available nutrient data from soil, leaf, or petiole tests when available.

messages.content:
आपकी फसल टमाटर वर्तमान में "वेजिटेटिव" चरण में है, जो 28 जुलाई 2025 से शुरू हुआ है। इस सप्ताह (पहला सप्ताह) के लिए निम्नलिखित खाद का उपयोग करें:

### वर्तमान सप्ताह (पहला सप्ताह):
1. **फर्टिगेशन विधि**:
   - **विकल्प 1**: 
     - 12-61-0: 3 किलोग्राम/एकड़
     - यूरिया: 3 किलोग्राम/एकड़
   - **विकल्प 2**: 
     - 24-24-0: 7 किलोग्राम/एकड़
     - फॉस्फोरिक एसिड 80%: 1 किलोग्राम/एकड़ (अन्य उर्वरकों के आवेदन से 15-20 मिनट पहले लगाएं)
   - **विकल्प 3**: 
     - यूरिया: 4 किलोग्राम/एकड़
     - फॉस्फोरिक एसिड 80%: 3 किलोग्राम/एकड़

### अगला सप्ताह (दूसरा सप्ताह):
- **शुरुआत की तारीख**: 8 सितंबर 2025
- **फर्टिगेशन विधि**:
   - **विकल्प 1**: 
     - पोटेशियम नाइट्रेट: 2 किलोग्राम/एकड़
     - यूरिया: 3 किलोग्राम/एकड़
     - मैग्नीशियम सल्फेट: 4.5 किलोग्राम/एकड़
   - **विकल्प 2**: 
     - यूरिया: 4 किलोग्राम/एकड़
     - सल्फेट ऑफ पोटाश: 2.5 किलोग्राम/एकड़
     - मैग्नीशियम सल्फेट: 4.5 किलोग्राम/एकड़

इन खादों का सही समय पर उपयोग करने से आपकी फसल की वृद्धि में मदद मिलेगी।
messages.en:
Your harvest tomatoes are currently in the "vegetative" stage, which has started on 28 July 2025. Use the following compost for this week (first week):

### Current Week (First Week):
1. **Fertigation Method**:
   - **Option 1**: 
     - 12-61-0: 3 kg/acre
     - Urea: 3 kg/acre
   - **Option 2**: 
     - 24-24-0: 7 kg/acre
     - Phosphoric acid 80%: 1 kg/acre (apply 15-20 minutes before application of other fertilizers)
   - **Option 3**: 
     - Urea: 4 kg/acre
     - Phosphoric acid 80%: 3 kg/acre

### Next week (Week 2):
- **Start Date**: 8 September 2025
- **Fertigation Method**:
   - **Option 1**: 
     - Potassium nitrate: 2 kg/acre
     - Urea: 3 kg/acre
     - Magnesium sulphate: 4.5 kg/acre
   - **Option 2**: 
     - Urea: 4 kg/acre
     - Sulphate of Potash: 2.5 kg/acre
     - Magnesium sulphate: 4.5 kg/acre

Using these fertilizers at the right time will help in the growth of your crop.

faq:
Q: which are the insecticide and fungicide to be used for seed treatment
A: Insecticide:  Imidacloprid 600 FS – 5 to 8 ml/kg seeds
Fungicide: Thiram – 2 to 3 gm/kg seed

messages.content:
आपकी टमाटर की फसल के लिए, निम्नलिखित फफूंदनाशक (फंगिसाइड) का उपयोग करें:

1. **कार्बेन्डाज़िम**: 1-2 ग्राम प्रति लीटर पानी
2. **मैनकोज़ेब**: 2-3 ग्राम प्रति लीटर पानी
3. **टेबुकोनाज़ोल**: 0.5-1 मिली प्रति लीटर पानी

इन फफूंदनाशकों का छिड़काव करने से फसल में फफूंद और अन्य बीमारियों से सुरक्षा मिलेगी। सुनिश्चित करें कि आप इन्हें सही समय पर और उचित मात्रा में उपयोग करें।
messages.en:
For your tomato crop, use the following fungicides:

1. Carbendazim : 1-2 grams per litre of water
2. Mancozeb: 2-3 grams per liter of water
Tebuconazole: 0.5-1 ml per litre of water

Spraying these fungicides will protect the crop from fungus and other diseases. Make sure you use them at the right time and in the right amounts.

messages.content: How to schedule a spray
messages.en: How to schedule a spray
messages.standalone_question: How can I schedule a spray?
messages.standalone_en: How can I schedule a spray?

tools:
check_spray_conditions  
Gets the spray condition forecast for the next few hours for the farmer's plots and returns the condition for each hour as GOOD, MODERATE, or WORST, based on deltaT, VPD, and rainfall conditions.

get_disease_pest_schedule  
Retrieves the farmer's current and past pesticide-related spray recommendations with spray details, based on dates. Dates are mandatory.
faq:
Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: I already took spray for this pest, but it is still showing high prediction/chances, why?
A: Taking a spray does not affect the prediction calculation. If you have already sprayed based on the fyllo notification,
   then wait a few days, if the fyllo app still recommends spray, only then spray again. Don't give any other reasons.

Q: Can fungicide and insecticide be sprayed together?
A: For fungicides and insecticides to be sprayed together, it is important to consider factors like compatibility. For expert guidance tailored to your situation, we recommend reaching out to Fyllo’s CRM number for personalized advice.

Q: How do I generate a fertigation schedule in the app?
A: To generate a fertigation schedule, follow these steps:

    1. Go to "My Farm"
    2. Select "Fertigation"
    3. Tap "Create Report"
    4. Fill in all the required details
    5. Save the report
    If you have soil, leaf, or petiole test data, you can input this for a more customized schedule. Otherwise, we can generate a basic schedule using general crop and regional data.

messages.content:
To schedule a spray, follow these steps:

1. **Check the Pest/Disease Prediction**: Look at the current pest or disease predictions for your crops to determine if spraying is necessary.

2. **Review Spray Conditions**: Ensure that the weather conditions are suitable for spraying. Ideal conditions include low wind, no rain, and appropriate temperature and humidity levels.

3. **Select the Right Time**: Choose a time of day when the conditions are optimal, usually early morning or late afternoon.

4. **Prepare the Spray Solution**: Mix the pesticide or fungicide according to the manufacturer's instructions.

5. **Apply the Spray**: Use appropriate equipment to apply the spray evenly across the affected areas.

6. **Record the Activity**: Document the date, time, and type of spray used for future reference.

If you need specific recommendations or schedules based on your plots, let me know!

messages.ans: dharti tells to how to nevigate and see spray and spray condition, so answer is fine.
messages.en: How to schedule a spray in fyllo
messages.standalone_question: How can I schedule a spray in Fyllo?
messages.standalone_en: How can I schedule a spray in Fyllo?

tools:
get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".
faq:
Q: Does Fyllo provide a fertigation schedule?
A: Yes, Fyllo provides a fertigation schedule for users.

Q: How can I trust that Fyllo's fertigation schedule is accurate?
A: Fyllo's fertigation schedule is scientifically developed and validated based on crop requirements. It takes into account factors such as crop variety, growth stage, soil conditions, and available nutrient data from soil, leaf, or petiole tests when available.

Q: Where can I find the fertigation schedule in the Fyllo app?
A: To access the fertigation schedule:
    1. Open the Fyllo app
    2. Select "My Farm" at the bottom
    3. Tap on the "Fertigation" option
   You'll find the fertigation schedule there, including details about the required fertilizer applications.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: How does the Fyllo device work?
A: The Fyllo device captures data from 11 sensors at regular intervals. This data is then analyzed using Fyllo's Weather & Agronomical Algorithms to provide alerts to farmers for disease & pest management, irrigation management, fertigation management, and weather prediction.

messages.content:
To schedule a spray in the Fyllo app, follow these steps:

1. **Open the Fyllo App**: Launch the app on your device.

2. **Select "My Farm"**: Navigate to the "My Farm" section at the bottom of the screen.

3. **Access Pest/Disease Information**: Check the pest or disease predictions for your crops to determine if spraying is necessary.

4. **Review Spray Conditions**: Look for the spray condition forecast to find the best times for spraying based on weather conditions.

5. **Schedule the Spray**: Choose an optimal time based on the conditions and your availability. 

6. **Record the Activity**: After spraying, document the date, time, and type of spray used for future reference.

If you need specific spray condition forecasts for your plots, let me know!

messages.content: How delta t is calculated
messages.ans: dharti gave generic answer. can add FAQ for these type.
messages.en: How delta t is calculated
messages.standalone_question: How is delta t calculated?
messages.standalone_en: How is delta t calculated?

messages.content:
Delta T is calculated by finding the difference between the dry bulb temperature and the wet bulb temperature. The formula is:

\[ \text{Delta T} = \text{Dry Bulb Temperature} - \text{Wet Bulb Temperature} \]

- **Dry Bulb Temperature**: This is the air temperature measured by a regular thermometer.
- **Wet Bulb Temperature**: This is the temperature measured by a thermometer that has a wet wick around its bulb, reflecting the cooling effect of evaporation.

Delta T is important for understanding plant transpiration and optimizing conditions for foliar applications.

messages.content_transliterated: mara dp wala plot man puchadiyun namano rog batave che to anna niyantran mate shu karvu

messages.content:
માફ કરશો, પરંતુ "ડીપી વાળા પ્લોટ" માટે પૂછડિયું નામના રોગના નિયંત્રણ માટે કોઈ વિશિષ્ટ માહિતી ઉપલબ્ધ નથી. 

આ રોગના નિયંત્રણ માટે સામાન્ય રીતે નીચેના પગલાં લઈ શકાય છે:

1. **સફાઈ**: પ્લોટમાંથી તમામ મરેલા પાંદડા અને કચરો દૂર કરો.
2. **જળવાયુ નિયંત્રણ**: જમીનને વધુ ભેજમાં રાખવા માટે યોગ્ય જળવાયુ વ્યવસ્થા કરો.
3. **પેસ્ટિસાઇડ્સ**: યોગ્ય પેસ્ટિસાઇડ્સનો ઉપયોગ કરો, જે ખાસ કરીને આ રોગ માટે અસરકારક હોય.
4. **પ્લોટની દેખરેખ**: નિયમિત રીતે પ્લોટની દેખરેખ રાખો અને રોગના લક્ષણો જોતા જ તરત જ પગલાં લો.

જો તમને વધુ માહિતી અથવા સહાયની જરૂર હોય, તો કૃપા કરીને જણાવો.
messages.en:
Sorry, but there is no specific information available for the control of a disease called puddle for a "plot with DP". 

The following steps can generally be taken to control the disease:

1. **Clean**: Remove all the dead leaves and waste from the plot.
2. **Climate Control**: Make proper climate management to keep the soil more humid.
3. **Pesticides**: Use the right pesticides, which are especially effective for this disease.
4. **Plot supervision**: Monitor the plot regularly and take immediate action as soon as you notice the symptoms of the disease.

If you need more information or assistance, please let us know.

જો તમે અગાઉથી કોઈ પેસ્ટિસાઇડ વાપર્યા હોય અને રોગના લક્ષણો હજુ પણ દેખાઈ રહ્યા હોય, તો કૃપા કરીને થોડા દિવસો રાહ જુઓ. જો ફાયલો એપ્લિકેશન ફરીથી સ્પ્રે કરવાની ભલામણ કરે છે, તો ત્યારે જ ફરીથી સ્પ્રે કરો. 

જો તમને વધુ સહાયની જરૂર હોય, તો કૃપા કરીને જણાવો.
messages.en:
Currently there is no pesticide spray schedule available for "plots with DP". 

If you have already used a pesticide and the symptoms of the disease are still showing up, please wait a few days. Spray again only if the phylo app recommends re-spraying. 

If you need more help, please let me know.
